summary: Tested all 6 form modals (Send Invoice, Add Deadline, Add Case Contact, Add Task, Send Mail, Add Asset/Debt). Found and fixed payload key mismatch in AddAssetDebtModal.js - was using Airtable field names instead of camelCase keys. All forms now submit successfully.
passed_tests: Send Invoice form - fills matter, service, amount and submits successfully (200 OK)
Add Deadline form - fills event, date, matter and submits successfully (200 OK)
Add Case Contact form - fills name, type (Heir) and submits successfully (200 OK)
Add Task form - fills task description and submits successfully (200 OK)
Send Mail form - fills recipient, what is being mailed, address and submits successfully (200 OK)
Add Asset/Debt form - fills name, asset type and submits successfully (200 OK after fix)
updated_files: /app/frontend/src/components/modals/AddAssetDebtModal.js - Fixed payload keys from Airtable field names to camelCase
seed_data_creation: Created test records: Invoice, Deadline, Case Contact, Task, Mail, Asset
context_for_next_testing_agent: All 6 action modal forms tested and working. AddAssetDebtModal.js was fixed to use camelCase keys (name, asset_or_debt, type_of_asset, type_of_debt, value, status, notes, master_list_id) instead of Airtable field names. Other forms (SendInvoice, AddDeadline, AddContact, AddTask, SendMail) were already using correct camelCase keys.
